Account : Cision
Project name: Cision
Month and year: Dec 2024
Key contributors: Ravi Numboori

Category / GenAI: Gen AI
Category Description: Raw content converted to a Structured PR Article for Preview & Approval
Problem statement: Customers send required article content and often had to wait for the backend editorial team to manually process their press releases before they could see a preview for further corrections. Any missing critical sections (e.g., headline, dateline, contact information) were only identified during editorial review leading to further delay in publication.
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): Real-Time Press Release Preview and Validation
Extract Word document content to Markdown Format - (custom Development)
Use Google Gemini to parse Markdown content and identify key sections (Headline, sub headline, body, dateline, contact info).
Generate JSON output from AI and convert to HTML preview for real-time validation.
Expose an API with above functionality to consume in the UI.
Reactive
/Proactive: Proactive
Impact: Increase engagement and ready reccommendation reduces need for more content readiness from customers
Accion team Contribution: Research on Vertex AI

Category / GenAI: Gen AI

Account : LSAC
Project name: LSAC
Month and year: Dec-24
Key contributors: Aditya Mukkawar
Category / GenAI: AI
Category Description: Report generation
Problem statement: The report generation API was fetching all school records and calculating job scores at runtime, resulting in very high Cosmos DB RU consumption and slow response times. This API is used in ~80% of user interactions, directly impacting user experience.
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): Redesigned the flow to pre-calculate job scores for all schools during onboarding and store them in Cosmos DB. Introduced a new getUserJobScores query to fetch precomputed data instead of recalculating at runtime. Maintained a school version in the job score document to trigger recalculation when school data changes.
Tools: Azure Cosmos DB, .NET APIs, Application Insights for RU and performance analysis.
Reactive
/Proactive:  Reactive
Impact: RU consumption reduced, PI response time improved by approximately 11x, Significant performance improvement for an API handling ~80% of LST user traffic
Accion team Contribution: Performed analysis to identify high RU usage, implemented the required changes, and validated the performance improvements using telemetry and logs.

Account : LeadVenture
Project name: LeadVenture - ML
Month and year: Jun-25
Key contributors: Prathmesh, Trupti
Category / GenAI: New feature
Category Description: Tech Debt/Modernization

LeadVenture has two separate applications for VIN Decoding - one for Retail clients and the other for Wholesale clients.  The Accion Team recommended building APIs that check the two databases (as using a single database is not an option currently), when new VINs are created or updates were done. This has lead to huge time-savings (as the dealer does not have to check multiple places) and productivity and financial gains, leading to added revenue. Fetching the VIN data from a 3rd party data provider cost LV money, and this code helped save money by avoiding multiple hits to the 3rd party database. The VIN data was also reused helping improve revenue and margins.
Problem statement: We requests were ckecking with WholeSale & Retail servers for VIN details
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): VIN decoding, before ckecking with WholeSale & Retail server. Created new API to check the existing DB before hitting providers
Reactive
/Proactive: Reactive
Impact: It saves lot of cost due to reduced calls to wholesale and retail servers
Accion team Contribution: Problem statement came from LV but solution and implemention came from Accion team
Client Appreciation (if any): Verbal

Account : LeadVenture
Project name: LeadVenture - PSM
Month and year: Jul-25
Key contributors: Alok, Chandan, Manikanandan
Category / GenAI: Performance Optimization
Category Description: Tech Debt/Modernization
Problem statement: Lead hunter website landing page was taking about ~3 minutes to load
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): Earlier, the data was being calculated by joining multiple tables, some of which were located in different databases. This approach was inefficient and impacted performance.

To address this, we proposed running a scheduled job that fetches and consolidates the required data every 4 hours. The client application will then retrieve the information directly from this prefetched table, ensuring faster response times and reduced load on the underlying databases.

Implemented new architecture with CQRS pattern which gets its data from a flat seprate table with prefectched value. It works as deffered fetch as volume of data is in 200 Millions. The solution reduced the load time to less than 3 seconds.
Reactive
/Proactive: Reactive
Impact: Performance improved from 3 minutes to 3 seconds  a 1000% improvement in response time.
Accion team Contribution: Problem is reported by Client, but solution is proosed by Accion team
Client Appreciation (if any): AEM team already got appreciation from Tia (Product manager) and Damon (LV manager)

Account : LeadVenture
Project name: LeadVenture - PSM - DRS
Month and year: Jul-25
Key contributors: Kiran
Category / GenAI: Architecture
Category Description: Process Improvement 
Problem statement: Currently, the user deletion service is not restricted to a single execution. It may run concurrently across multiple instances of the by-users-service, which is not the intended behavior.
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): At any given time, only one instance of the user service should acquire the distributed lock and perform the stale user deletion.
All other instances should skip the deletion logic if the lock is already held. Redis is used as the distributed locking mechanism to coordinate this behavior.

The solution implemented ensures that the stale user deletion logic within the user service executes only once across multiple service instances in any given environment. This is to prevent race conditions and ensure data consistency in a microservices architecture.
Reactive
/Proactive: Reactive
Impact: Introduces a dependency on Redis for distributed locking.

No impact on other services or APIs.

No changes to user-facing functionality or data models.

Ensures smooth functioning of user deletion without deadlocks or race conditions.

Provides system predictability:

Guarantees only one service instance performs the deletion at a time.

Enables easy time tracking and log verification.
Accion team Contribution: Problem statement came from LV but solution and implemention came from Accion team

Account : LeadVenture
Project name: LeadVenture - PSM
Month and year: Aug-25
Key contributors: Alok, Navanit
Category / GenAI: Performance Optimization
Category Description: Tech debt/Modernization
Problem statement: Email sending feature is crashing at peak hours due to bottleneck of large volume table insertion
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): The PSM application uses SendGrid for sending emails. To track these emails, we log each record into a normalized table which also supports various reporting needs. Currently, this table holds ~700 million records.

The challenge was that direct insertions into this table were taking ~10 minutes for 5,000 records, and in some cases, the process would even crash due to the high indexing overhead.

Solution implemented:

Introduced a staging table without indexes to handle incoming inserts efficiently.

Data is then moved in batches from this staging table to the original normalized table.

This approach has significantly reduced insertion time and improved system stability for large-scale email tracking.
Reactive
/Proactive: Proactive 
Impact: Bottleneck is removed and email sending for 30000 records takes minutes only, Exponential improvment
Accion team Contribution: Both problem identification & solution is proosed by Accion team
Client Appreciation (if any): In Progress, planned Production date in September.

Account : Pollard Banknote
Project name: All Projects
Month and year: Nov-25
Key contributors: Abash, Anand (?)
Category / GenAI: Onboarding and Rampup
Category Description: Created a detailed onboarding Kit with KT videos and documentation covering Functional and Technical areas

Quick Rampup for new joiners
Problem statement: Onboarding of new team members was time-consuming and inefficient due to the absence of a centralized onboarding mechanism. Knowledge Transfer (KT) videos and supporting documentation were scattered across multiple locations and owned by different team members. 
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): A comprehensive and centralized onboarding kit was created, consisting of structured KT videos and detailed documentation. 

All onboarding materials were consolidated into a single, easily accessible repository and organized by modules and roles. This enabled a new joiner to ramp up with 2 weeksand reduced the dependency to have in person KT sessions. 

This process also helped to guage the knowledge gained with Reverse KT sessions which gave the feedback of how a new joiner has gained and identify the gaps and close the same quickly. 

Added provision to shared feedback on the session which helped to improve the KT content and keep evolving over the time 
Reactive
/Proactive: Proactive
Impact: Saved valuable time for the client by avoiding the need of in person and repeated KT sessions everytime for new joiners and ad-hoc follow-ups.

Established a standardized and easy-to-follow onboarding process, ensuring consistent knowledge transfer across all new joiners.

Improved overall onboarding efficiency and scalability, allowing the client to onboard resources quickly with minimal disruption to ongoing project work.

Problem statement: 
Performance
The current map implementation faces out-of-memory issues when rendering large and complex polygons, impacting system stability and user experience.

System Modernization  Monitoring
Existing monitoring setup has high recurring licensing costs, limited flexibility in dashboard customization, and misalignment with internal engineering standards.

System Modernization  Deployment
Spinnaker operates as a heavy microservices-based deployment platform.
Requires dedicated DevOps ownership.
Upgrade, scaling, and maintenance efforts are complex and time-consuming.

Operational Excellence
Need to strengthen business continuity and application availability to ensure minimal downtime during regional or infrastructure failures.
Value solution (Mention LLMs, Tools used): Performance & Optimization
Optimized polygon processing logic using GIS tools and libraries.
Improved memory handling and data filtering for large geographic datasets.
Leveraged Enterprise ChatGPT and GitHub Copilot to analyze bottlenecks and accelerate solution design.

System Modernization  Monitoring
Migrated monitoring and alerting from Datadog to Grafana to reduce licensing costs.
Enabled flexible, customizable dashboards aligned with internal engineering standards.
Used Enterprise ChatGPT and Copilot to support migration planning and validation.

System Modernization  Deployment
Migrated deployment workflows from Spinnaker to Argo CD.
Adopted a GitOps-based approach to simplify deployments and reduce operational overhead.
Used Enterprise ChatGPT and Copilot during migration for configuration analysis, pipeline conversion, and validation.

Operational Excellence  Disaster Recovery
Set up new infrastructure in an alternate region.
Implemented regular monthly failover testing to validate disaster recovery readiness.
Ensured high availability and improved system resilience.
Impact: Improved application performance and stability for large map data.

Eliminated memory-related failures during high-volume processing.

Reduced recurring monitoring and infrastructure costs.

Simplified deployment processes and reduced dependency on specialized DevOps resources.

Improved system reliability, availability, and disaster recovery confidence.

Strengthened customer trust through improved resilience and uptime.
